metadata.title: SARS-CoV-2 Encodes a PPxY Late Domain Motif that is Known to Enhance Budding and Spread in Enveloped RNA Viruses 2 3 Halim Maaroufi 4

body_text.text: Currently, the global COVID-19 (Coronavirus Disease-2019) pandemic caused by SARS- 28 CoV-2 from Wuhan is affecting the health (including psychology) and/or socioeconomic 29 life of almost each citizen in the world. Finding vaccines and therapeutics to fight CoV-2 30 is urgent. In addition, it is necessary to continue this great research effort in the next years 31 to elucidate the molecular mechanisms (tropism, cell entry, multiplication and spread, etc) 32 that emerging viruses (now SARS-CoV-2) use to infect humans. This knowledge is an 33 investment for the future to prevent and/or control emergence of dangerous viruses that 34 may be could be more terrible for humanity than SARS-CoV-2. The family of The envelope-anchored SARS-CoV-2 spike (S) is a multifunctional glycoprotein with 42 1273 amino acid residues. Its structure was resolved as a homotrimeric with several 43 domains. S protein is subdivided into S1 and S2 subunits. S1 is formed by two domains, Sequence analysis of SARS-CoV-2 spike protein by the eukaryotic linear motif (ELM) PPxY motif is also present in S protein of bat RaTG13and pangolin GX-P5L (Fig. 1A) .

Moreover, S proteins with PPxY motif are phylogenetically close (Fig. 1C) . Interestingly, 100 alignment of S protein sequences of the two pangolins showed only two differences in S1 PPxY motif is important for virulence. Figure 1B

The hot region in S protein contains also Ser/Thr phosphorylated motifs. Indeed, PPxY 130 motif shares also its Pro25 with an overlapping 19 TTRTQLP 25 that could be phosphorylated . FIGREF0.text: 35 coronaviruses (CoVs) is large and composed of single positive-stranded enveloped RNA 36 viruses (Graham and Baric, 2010; Li, 2013). Among all RNA viruses, CoVs possess the 37 largest genome, typically between 27.000 and 32.000 nucleotides. They are classified into 38 Alpha-, Beta-, Gamma-, and Deltacoronavirus genetic genera and can infect both 39 mammalian and avian species. Phylogenetically, SARS-CoV-2 is more close to SARS-40 CoV than MERS-CoV, but all belong to betacoronavirus (betaCoVs) (de Wit et al., 2016).

FIGREF2.text: 44 an N-terminal domain (NTD) and a C-terminal receptor-binding domain (RBD) that binds 45 specifically the host receptor angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) on the host cell 46 surface (Li, 2012). Whereas, S2 subunit is also multidomains and induces viral and host 47 membranes fusion. 48 The viral proline-rich Pro-Pro-x-Tyr (PPxY) Late or L-domain motif (Chen and Sudol, 49 1995) interacts with host proteins containing WW-domain. The term Late reflects late 50 function in virus lifecycle (Freed, 2002). L-domain motifs are identified in enveloped RNA 51 viruses such as in Gag of number of retroviruses and in matrix of arenaviruses, 52 rhabdoviruses and filoviruses (Baillet et al., 2019; Bieniasz, 2006; Wirblich et al., 2008).

FIGREF3.text: 53 WW-domain is a small domain of 35-40 amino acids, named after two conserved 54 tryptophan (W) residues in the sequence (Bork and Sudol, 1994). It is a fold of three-stranded 55 antiparallel β-sheet that contains two ligand-binding grooves (Huang et al., 2000; Kanelis

FIGREF4.text: 79 resource (http://elm.eu.org/) revealed a short linear motif (SLiMs) known as PPxY Late 80 (L-) domain motif, 25 PPAY 28 in N-terminal of S1 subunit. PPxY L-domain motif interacts 81 with proteins containing WW-domain (s). The term Late reflects late function in virus 82 lifecycle (Freed, 2002). L-domain motifs were identified in single stranded enveloped RNA 83 viruses (Table 1). In Gag protein of number of retroviruses and in matrix of arenaviruses, 84 rhabdoviruses and filoviruses (Baillet et al., 2019; Bieniasz, 2006; Wirblich et al., 2008). 85 RNA viruses use PPxY L-domain motif to recruit specific WW-domain of host proteins of 86 Nedd4 family members and ultimately the ESCRT complex to facilitate their budding and 87 egress (Bieniasz, 2006). Interestingly, SARS-CoV-2 S protein and Nedd4 can be S-88 palmitoylated, suggesting that they can be localize to similar membrane subdomains (Petit 89 et al., 2007; Gordon et al., 2020; Chesarino et al., 2014). Therefore, they could be able to 90 interact. In addition, ScanProsite tool (https://prosite.expasy.org/scanprosite/) is used to 91 verify if PPxY motif is present elsewhere in SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV proteins. PPxY 92 motif is absent in SARS-CoV and only present in S protein of SARS-CoV-2. It has been 93 reported in enveloped RNA viruses that PPxY motif recruits Nedd4 E3 ubiquitin ligases 94 and ultimately the ESCRT complex to enhance virus budding and release that means a high 95 viral load, thus facilitating new infections. Note that PPxY motif is not present in proteins 96 of SARS-CoV. This suggests that PPxY motif by its role in enhancing the viral load could 97 explain why SARS-CoV-2 is more contagious than SARS-CoV (To et al., 2020).

FIGREF8.text: shows the difference in coronaviruses 105 counterpart nucleotides of codon Pro25 of SARS-CoV-2. Transition mutations (purine (A, purine to pyrimidine or Vis versa) mutations. Additionally, in codons most 108 substitutions appear in the third nucleotide base (silent mutations), less is the first base, and 109 the least substitutions happen in the second nucleotide base (Wang et al., 2007). Therefore, 110it is more probable that mutation from Ala (GCT) to Pro (CCT) occurs than Gln (CAG) to 111 Pro (CCG). Moreover, a double mutation is less probable from Asn (AAT) to Proline 112 (CCT)(Fig. 1B).

FIGREF9.text: -domain motif is in hot region 115 116 Scanning SARS-CoV-2 S protein sequence with DisEMBL software (Linding et al., 2003) 117 revealed in the N-terminal region a unique hot disordered loop 19 TTRTQLPPAYTNSFT 33 118 that includes PPxY motif (Table 2). In addition, this loop contains other motifs. Indeed, 119 PPxY motif shares its tyrosine with an overlapping 28 YTNSF 32 motif (Fig. 1A) that when 120 its Tyr28 is phosphorylated it allows binding SH2 domain of STAP1. STAP1 (Signal 121 Adaptor Protein 1) is an adaptor protein with an SH2 and a PH class of lipid-binding 122 domain (Wang et al., 1994). It is expressed in lymphoid cells and is phosphorylated by the 123 Tec tyrosine kinase (Tec TK), which participates in B cell antigen receptor signaling (Ohya 124 et al., 1999; Yang et al., 2001). It has been showed in polyoma virus that when its middle 125 T-antigen is phosphorylated on tyrosine, it acts as a binding site for the SH2 domain of 126 phosphatidylinositol-3'OH kinase 85K subunit (Dilworth et al. 1994). Another site, 127 28 YTNS 31 in S protein is also Tyr phosphorylation depending for binding SH2 domain. 128 (Lin et al., 2006).

FIGREF10.text: 131 at TQ motif by Phosphatidylinositol 3-and/or 4-kinase (PIKKs). The Gln (Q) beside to the 132 target Ser/Thr is critical for the substrate recognition. PIKKs are Ser/Thr atypical kinases 133 that are found only in eukaryotes (Imseng et al., 2108; Angira et al., 2020). Interestingly, 134 Yang et al. (2012) showed that phosphatidylinositol 4-kinase IIIβ (PI4KB) is required for 135 cellular entry by pseudoviruses bearing the SARS-CoV S protein. This cell entry is highly 136 inhibited by knockdown of PI4KB. Moreover, they demonstrated that PI4KB does not 137 affect virus entry at the SARS-CoV S-ACE2 interface. Finally, 26 PAYTNSFT 33 is up this section, proteins that interacts with this hot disordered loop are connected 143 to lipids (membrane), particularly with phosphatidylinositol, and the regulation of 144 bindings is made by phosphorylation. Recently, Besson et al. (2019) identified that 145 mitogen-activated protein kinase pathway and phosphatidylinositol metabolism are 146 involved in the later stage of RABV infection.

FIGREF11.text: PPxY L-domain motif with Nedd4-WW3-domain Ub ligase 149 150 To compare the interactions of PPAY S protein-Nedd4WW-domain complex with other 151 complexes of PPxY-Nedd4WW-domain, molecular docking was performed with the 152 software AutoDock vina (Trott and Olson, 2010). Fig. 2 shows that 23 QLPPAYTNS 31 153 peptide of SARS-CoV-2 S protein is localized in the same region as 112 TAPPEYMEA 120 154 of Zaire Ebola virus Matrix protein VP40 (PDBid: 2KQ0) and important amino acids of 155 SARS-CoV-2 peptide are superposed with those of Ebola VP40 peptide, except the 156 orientation of aromatic ring of tyrosine (Fig. B and C). Iglesias-Bexiga et al. (2019) 157 reported that Nedd4-WW3 binding site is highly plastic and can accommodate PPxY-158 containing ligands with varying orientations. This structural superposition with PPxY of 159 VP40 confirmed the reliability of AutoDock vina peptide docking module. Knowing 160 molecular interactions of 23 QLPPAYTNS 31 and Nedd4WW-domain will help to design a 161 peptide able to mimic the surface of Nedd4 WW-domain and to strongly bind to 162 23 QLPPAYTNS 31 peptide preventing the recruitment of Nedd4 E3 ubiquitin ligase by 163 SARS-CoV-2 S protein (Zaidman and Wolfson, 2016). Indeed, Han et al. (2014) have 164 developed two lead compounds that specifically block the VP40 PPxY-host Nedd4 165 interaction with an antibudding activity into the nanomolar range.

FIGREF12.text: probable short linear motifs (SLiMs), SARS-CoV-2 spike protein sequence was 175 scanned with the eukaryotic linear motif (ELM) resource (http://elm.eu.org/). PPxY L-176 domain motif was searched in proteins of SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV using 177 https://prosite.expasy.org/scanprosite/ 178 179 3D modeling and molecular docking 180 181 Unfortunately, the region containing 23 QLPPAYTNS 31 peptide has not been resolved in all 182 known structures of spike S protein. So, Pep-Fold (Thevenet et al., 2012) software was 183 used to model de novo this peptide. The model quality of the peptide was assessed by 184 analysis of a Ramachandran plot through PROCHECK (Vaguine et al., 1999). 185 The docking of the peptide into human Nedd4 3rd WW-domain (PDBid: 2KQ0_A) was 186 performed with the software AutoDock vina (Trott and Olson, 2010). The 3D complex 187 containing human Nedd4 3rd WW-domain and peptide was refined by using FlexPepDock 188 (London et al., 2011), which allows full flexibility to the peptide and side-chain flexibility 189 to the receptor.

FIGREF13.text: residues sequences of spike (S) protein of SARS-CoV-2 (accession: 194 YP_009724390.1), SARS-Cov (P59594.1), bat_coronavirus_RaTG13 (QHR63300.2), 195 pangolin_PCoV_GX-P5L (QIA48632.1), pangolin_PCoV_GX-P1E (QIA48623.1), 196 bat_CoVZC45_CoV (AVP78031.1) and bat_Rs4874_CoV (ATO98205.1), were aligned 197 with T-coffee software (Rius et al., 2011). This multiple alignment is used to establish the 198 phylogenetic relationships between SARS-CoV-2 and others coronaviruses. The 199 phylogenetic tree was constructed with MrBayes (Huelsenbeck and Ronquist, 2001) using: 200 Likelihood model (Number of substitution types: 6(GTR); Substitution model: Poisson; 201Rates variation across sites: Invariable + gamma); Markov Chain Monte Carlo parameters like to thank the IBIS bioinformatics group for their assistance.

TABREF0.text: et al., 2001). RNA viruses use PPxY L-domain motif to recruit specific WW-domain of host proteins of either Nedd4 (Neuronal precursor cell-Expressed Developmentally Downregulated 4), or Nedd4 family members to facilitate their egress and spread (Bieniasz, 2006). Nedd4 proteins family have three domains, N-terminal lipid binding (C2) domain; WW modules, present in multiple copies; and a C-terminal Hect (for homologous to E6associated protein C terminus) domain that contains the ubiquitin ligase activity. Previous and current works are focusing to understand the first step that allows SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 to entry host cell. Principally, these works are studying interaction between C-terminal receptor-binding domain (RBD) of S protein and the host receptor angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2). Here, molecular mechanism of the last step (late function virus life cycle) of budding and release of virus is presented. The N-terminal of SARS-CoV-2 spike protein contains a PPxY L-domain motif that is known to hijack host WW-domain of Nedd4 E3 ubiquitin ligases and ultimately the ESCRT (Endosomal Sorting Complex Required for Transport) complex to enhance virus budding and spread.Importantly, this motif is absent in SARS-CoV that could explain why SARS-CoV-2 is more contagious than SARS-CoV. Developing a novel host-oriented inhibitor of molecular interactions of PPxY-host WW-domain will be welcome to struggle SARS-The N-terminal of S protein contains a PPxY L-domain motif
